fields.description:
It seems Bamboo does not synchronise group memberships while running.

Steps to reproduce:
# Ensure Bamboo is already enabled and running.
# Add a non-administrator user to the 'administrators' group in JIRA.
# As that user, attempt to access Bamboo's administration tab.

The user will be met with a 'Permission Denied' screen.

The user should be able to admin Bamboo as per the Restricted Admin permission scheme.

The workaround is to restart Bamboo, as it seems to synchronise group memberships on start-up.
fields.summary: No automatic group membership synchronisation in Bamboo

fields.description:
Search results are inconsistent when working with source filenames, commit messages, and wiki content.    Wildcards are required to match words contained in a filename, but will prevent results contained in commit messages and some wiki matches from being returned.  Here's an example of the problem and the steps to reproduce.

# Make a commit that contains the word "potzrebie" (something that won't allow stemming)
# Add and commit a file whose name contains the full word, but which is longer, such as "potzrebie test.txt"
# Update a wiki page so that it contains the word "potzrebie"
# Searching for "potzrebie", "potzrebie*" and "potzreb*" will return different results.
# Searching for "potzrebie AND potzrebie*" will return spurious results that don't contain any variation on the search term
# Searching for "potzrebie OR potzrebie*" will return the full range of results more or less as expected

Searching should behave consistently and intuitively across the full range of products.
fields.summary: Inconsistent searching between source and wiki content
Update com.atlassian.jira.rpc.auth.TokenManagerImpl

fields.description:
After updating to 2.2-rc4, public sign-up on StAC no longer works. You get an error page.

Details at https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-7349

I've verified this on dev.jira.com and a local dev build.
fields.summary: Public sign up does not work

fields.description:
When adding a Google Gadget that includes preferences as an external gadget, adding the gadget works, but the edit screen remains hidden, and thus it's not possible to enter preferences or cancel out of the edit.  Steps to reproduce:

# Add an external gadget to your Studio instance, such as one of the following
#*http://www.google.com/ig/modules/tabnews.xml
#*http://hosting.gmodules.com/ig/gadgets/file/112581010116074801021/hamster.xml
# Add the gadget to a dashboard
# Attempt to edit the Gadget preferences
# The gadget will resize, but the controls will not be displayed.

Customers can work around the problem by adding the following to a user stylesheet that's applied to content loaded from their hostname.  

{code}
.dashboard-item-content .hidden, .dashboard-item-content li.hidden { visibility: visible !important }
{code}

The method of applying the workaround is unfortunately browser-specific.  Here are some tools and tips that can help with common browsers:

* [User Stylesheets in Internet Explorer|http://webdesign.about.com/od/css/ht/htcssuseriewin.htm]
* [Stylish for Chrome|https://chrome.google.com/extensions/detail/fjnbnpbmkenffdnngjfgmeleoegfcffe?hl=en]
* [Stylish for Firefox|https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/addon/2108/]
* Safari:  Use the "Style Sheet" option in the "Advanced" section of the preferences panel.
fields.summary: Can't edit preferences for external gadget in Studio

fields.description:
Our prominence within the Google Apps Marketplace is mostly determined by the number of reviews we receive.  It would be great if every JIRA Studio + Google Apps user were prompted to write a review at some point during their usage of the tool (e.g. the 15th time they've logged in to Studio with the Activity Bar present, or some similar sign of ongoing usage).

Currently we can only request reviews from the technical contacts, but this would allow us to request reviews from far more JIRA Studio users, many of whom probably use the tool more extensively than the technical contact.
fields.summary: Add 'Write a Review' popup to the JIRA Studio Activity Bar

fields.description: In Confluence, when the page breadcrumb trail gets above a certain length, it replaces some of the segments in the middle with an ellipsis (...). In normal Confluence, clicking this ellipsis expands it to show the omitted breadcrumbs. In Studio, it does not.
fields.summary: The wiki breadcrumb ellipsis does not expand

fields.description: The SVN Commit Hooks page looks really strange. There is a box that doesn't actually surround all of the content of the page. The checkbox seems to be poorly aligned with other content. The Save and Cancel buttons should probably be on their own line. Maybe we should use AUI forms here.
fields.summary: Strange rendering on SVN Commit Hooks page

fields.description: JIRA Studio allows administrators to enable an SVN Commit Hook to require a valid JIRA issue key in the commit message. There is no documentation for this feature currently that I can find.
fields.summary: SVN Commit Hooks documentation
Duplicate Confluence Space project link the Studio project administration page.
Install ntpd on Studio for Google Apps authentication to work properly

fields.description:
This is pretty easy to replicate.

- Create a new Studio project, projectA
- Create a new wiki space, spaceB
- Associate spaceB to projectA
- While within any wiki space, open the Project dropdown and check the link to projectA.

You should notice that the link is still /wiki/projectA when it should actually be /wiki/spaceB.  This causes additional issues if the projectA wiki space was deleted.  Also while within spaceB, the applinks are not configurable such that it shows tabs with links to the other sections properly (sure, you can get the tabs to display, but they all point to the dashboard of each app).
fields.summary: Project dropdown links are not sync'd with actual project associations

fields.description:
If you have "/" as a configured path (studiohost/secure/admin/RepositoryProjectList.jspa), any specific group configurations there does not show up on the Manage Default Repository Permissions page (studiohost/secure/admin/ProjectRepositoryDefaults.jspa).  

The problem is if "/" has groupA with full commit permissions, when you go to the Manage Default Repository page, the page is empty.  If you try to add groupA to read, nothing happens and the UI remains the same.  This causes quite a bit of confusion since there aren't any errors or notifications that show up anywhere.
fields.summary: Fisheye SVN Permission Manager conflicts with Manage Default Repository Permissions

fields.description:
http://img.skitch.com/20100608-de3888skx3rm1dup5fmwu2k4y6.png

Any anchor links, particular crucible links as above, will cause errors to be emailed to the user that made the commit, as above.

A simple solution to this would be to only match # characters that are preceded by whitespace.
fields.summary: Commit command message parsing collides with anchor links

fields.description: the fix is to increase the z-index. 10000 works, 1000 doesn't.
fields.summary: User menu sits behind the stalker bar

fields.description:
There are still a few UI things that needs attention for users that have only Conlfuence (wiki) application access.

- Upon logging in, the user is told that their credentials are wrong and asked to login again.  
-- Actually, since the login prompt is located in JIRA (which they don't have permissions to use) the login should actually bounce them to a Not Permitted page. After being told their login is wrong, if they manually visit site/wiki they are logged into the wiki side just fine.
- There should be an option to hide tabs depending on what the current logged in user has access to, not just for Jira users only.

See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: Improve UI for confluence users only.

fields.description:
To reproduce:

1. go to any Confluence page,
2. click 'Edit' next to the 'Labels' heading,
3. start typing a known label.

Note that the auto-suggest box never shows up.

There don't seem to be any JavaScript errors generated. I've confirmed with Roy that it works with a standard Confluence 3.1 installation.
fields.summary: Confluence's labels do not auto-complete

fields.description: Recent versions should have much better JavaScript support.
fields.summary: Upgrade JWebUnit

fields.description: I would like my recent issues custom queries to sort by default on my update column, not Key.  I like to see what was done most recently for some queries, for others the Key sort is perfectly sufficient and a good generic default.

The space logo should be able to be selected or told to use the Studio project logo.
The global logo should be the JIRA global logo and should not be able to be selected.
fields.summary: Admins can change the space and global logo in Confluence

fields.description: Some of the options in the colour scheme editor are overridden by the studio theme, and therefore don't do anything. We should probably remove the option of changing the scheme here and get Confluence to use the scheme configured in JIRA.

/wiki/admin/viewgadgetdirectory.action (map to wiki > Configuration > External Gadgets)

fields.description:
Confluence "browse" dropdown arrow does not change colours with the Project, User, and History dropdown arrows.
JIRA dropdown arrows for Dashboards, Issues, Agile (etc) menus display the correct colour arrow in some circumstances, but other colours in other.
fields.summary: The selected dropdown arrow colour is not displayed consistently across products

fields.summary: Bamboo's activity streams returns 500 Internal Server Error when no builds has been run

fields.description:
We have blocked the administrators list in JIRA Studio, and in JIRA 4.1.1 it is always empty anyway. Unfortunately, the login gadget contains a link to it when public sign-up is disabled. We should investigate improving this.

Notes:

* This may already be addressed in JIRA 4.2. Someone should check this
* AFAIK JIRA Studio doesn't override the gadget provided by JIRA currently
* Since we may be making login changes to support GApps external users in 2.3, we should consider rolling this in as part of that change
fields.summary: 'Administrator' link in the login gadget points to a broken page
ThemeProperties should return default value when the placeholder token is not replaced.
Update FishEye and Crucible to 2.3
Update Bamboo to 2.6

fields.description:
Right now we're only running func tests with Bamboo enabled. That means that we're not properly testing the actual default experience, which can result in bugs like AOD-2489.

I'm willing to bet that we have several tests that will break in this configuration, so we need to estimate the time this will take accordingly.
fields.summary: Setup builds with Bamboo disabled
FishEye is showing URLs like %SVN-PUBLIC-URL%/THIRD/trunk

fields.description: The builds admin tab throws an error. In addition, error pages appear to get sent out as plain text rather than HTML.
fields.summary: Builds admin tab is broken

fields.description:
Text is misaligned.
Project menu - so far to the left it is gone, the rows are not tall enough.
JIRA top bar mini menus - icons overlap the text.
fields.summary: dev.jira.com css is broken

fields.description: In Crucible review of CR-JST project, type in the comment to include: [Test+Page], instead of generating /wiki/display/JST/Test+Page, it generates a link to /source/cru/Test+Page.
fields.summary: Linker markup in Crucible comment does not generate a link to the corresponding Wiki page, instead it points to a non-existent Crucible resource.

fields.description: It keeps resetting itself to show both. For one thing, this seems like the wrong default, if that is in fact the default setting. Second, I can't figure out what causes it to forget that I've told it to hide both. I need to figure out if this is a problem specific to StAC, specific to Studio, or with FishEye in general.
fields.summary: FishEye on StAC forgets 'Hide Empty Directories' and 'Hide Deleted Files' settings

fields.description:
There is an issue with version 1.9.5 release where using the changeset modifyColumn throws migration error stating jar in the classpath is missing. As recommended in the user dashboard for this known error, I added the modify-column.jar file  along with the main liquibase-1.9.5.jar in the ant build file and also updated its properties file for this new jar. This addition of patch to the main API does not work.

Convinced by the 92% agility of the version 2.0, I replaced liquibase-1.9.5.jar and the modify-column.jar  with liquibase-2.0.jar and upon re-running the changeset of modifyColumn still reports the same error.
fields.summary: ChangeSet modifyColumn in version 2.0 throws the same error of missing jar in the classpath
Upgrade to latest version of TestNG so that we can log the start time and duration of configuration methods

fields.description:
this is similar to PL-357.

When administering our Jira Studio account, all of the help links in JST link to non-existent pages in confluence (accessed via the /JIRASTUDIO URI).

E.g. Administration -> Issues (defaults to Permissions group). The URL of the Help icon is http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Managing+Global+Permissions?clicked=jirastudiohelp. None of the pages exist in confluence though.

This has been tested on 4 or 5 help icons. There does seem to be content under /JIRA/ for all relevant topics though.
fields.summary: Help links are all broken

fields.description:
Clicking preview on a Google Doc attached to a JIRA issue does not display images within the Google Doc.

public mirror of AGMP-635.
fields.summary: Clicking preview on a Google Doc attached to a JIRA issue does not display images within the Google Doc.

fields.description:
https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/6241

I need to specified the JIRA version on the Bamboo build plan.
So that each time the plan run, it can deploy the right version number to right location specify by plan.
In case we need to manage many version of one project and we use version number to specified the location.
fields.summary: Consider bundling Bamboo JIRA Version Plugin
Ignore patch failures when rebuilding an application
Upgrade to Confluence 3.1.2

fields.description:
I wanted to use the project avatar as the project logo so I set it to

https://labs.atlassian.com/secure/projectavatar?size=large&pid=10405&avatarId=10040

which should resolve to the configured project avatar: 

!https://labs.atlassian.com/secure/projectavatar?size=large&pid=10405&avatarId=10040!

But it doesn't work on the top left, though it does work in the preview. The url has been double escaped to this:

https://labs.atlassian.com/secure/projectavatar?size=large&amp;pid=10405&amp;avatarId=10040

affects this version I am using (says it's 2.2 but 2.2 appears to be "unreleased")
fields.summary: logo url is double escaped

fields.description:
There appears to be some look & feel problems with values not saving.

1. Change the logo, and manually input the width value and save.  Upon editing the Look & Feel again, it does don't populate with the earlier dimension value we inputted.

2. The *Header Separator Color* does not save our changes.

Behaviour for 2.3:

1. Change the logo, and save. Configure Look & Feel again, edit some other settings in that page and Save. The customised logo is now reverted to original logo

2. Change the date/time format. Configure Look & Feel again, edit some other settings in that page and Save. The customised date/time format is now reverted to original format
fields.summary: Look & Feel values not saving

fields.description: It's currently at 768M, it should be at something in the order of 128M.
fields.summary: Crowd has too much RAM

fields.description:
Currently the SVN URL stored in AppLinks is private URL using file protocol, which is not suitable for Source check out instruction or Bamboo build check out from remote agent.

Source check out currently uses a hack from AppLinks Core: URLHelper.getSvnPublicUrl(jiraBaseUrl), while Bamboo SVN repo URL is retrieved from ThemeProperties, which is eventually from studio.properties/studio.default.properties.

A proper fix is currently blocked by APL-155.
fields.summary: SVN public URL is not retrieved from AppLinks

fields.description:
The [JIRA Mercurial plugin|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JHG/Home] allows JIRA to interact with Mercurial repositories in a similar way to the [JIRA SVN plugin|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/SVN/Subversion+JIRA+plugin].

It should be fairly easy to install and configure, however it requires that Mercurial (hg) be installed onto the base image.
fields.summary: Install Mercurial onto Studio base image

fields.description:
Have a look at most of the changes to this page, and you'll see that every time the page is saved in the RTE, it gains extra whitespace following the "smart links" to JIRA issues in the same Studio project.

https://studio.atlassian.com/wiki/pages/diffpages.action?originalId=36569248&pageId=36569250

Needless to say, it's a bit annoying when your links keep getting an extra space after every save. :)
fields.summary: Links to JIRA issues from Confluence pages add extra trailing space when round-tripping

fields.description: If you accidentally create a review in the default Crucible project prior to the upgrade to JIRA Studio 2.2, after the upgrade it is inaccessible. You will get a permission denied error if you visit the URL.
fields.summary: Reviews in the default project are inaccessible after the upgrade to 2.2

fields.description: In Gapps instances there are three options for new users, "No Access", "Collaborator Access" and "Developer Access". When the default access level for new users is set to "No Access", and a new user is synchronised, they appear in the User Browser with account type "Collaborator".  Insert confusion here.  It would be better if the account type for users without access to JIRA was listed as "No Access".
fields.summary: Account type for users with no access to JIRA should be "No Access"

fields.description:
The documentation for [gapps user synchronisation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASTUDIO/Synchronising+JIRA+Studio+and+Google+Apps+Users] doesn't seem to mention anything about the default access level for new users:

[^gapps-access.png]

In particular, "No Access" needs to be thoroughly explained... users with no access will be created on JIRA Studio, and will have account type Collaborator in the user browser (I'll create a separate issue to do something about that), however, they will not be in any groups (in particular, the users group), and so won't have access to JIRA.
fields.summary: Document default access level for new users

fields.description: Currently a NullPointerException is thrown if a project link is not configured to SVN from a Bamboo project when you attempt to create a plan.  The code should be more forgiving and allow defaulting to the instance level applink in this case, or if there is none, throw a more meaningful exception.
fields.summary: Better handling of badly configured SVN AppLinks in Bamboo

fields.description:
Customers are being blocks from the "Configure Whitelist" admin function in the wiki.

http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257342173
fields.summary: "Forbidden" error when configuring wiki whitelist
Change the "Create Review" link the "Tools" dropdown to create Review under the currently selected project

fields.description: It's possible for project creation to fail partway through, and you end up with a project in JIRA but, for example, no Subversion, FishEye, Crucible, etc. projects/repos. Repairing this manually is time consuming and error-prone. There should be a way for a project admin to click "Repair" or "Synchronize" or something like that and have it automatically create or update missing configuration across the apps.
fields.summary: Add a project repair function

fields.description: Customers that have SLAs or other constraints on resolution time may want to query JIRA for issues that fall outside of a particular range. Currently, there is no built-in way to do this.
fields.summary: Add a custom field or JQL function for searching on time between creation and resolution

fields.description: By default, avatars are disabled in fecru 2.2, resulting in lots of grey icons. Write an upgrade task that sets it to 'internal'.
fields.summary: Write an upgrade task for fecru avatar settings
User Profile > Reviews Preferences is broken
User Profile > Source Preferences is broken

fields.description:
Problems found so far:
- hovering over avatar picture gives me error all the time (in every page)
- https://studio.atlassian.com/source/users?timeout=250000 always times out
- https://studio.atlassian.com/source/plugins/servlet/review-blockers/ gives me always the Maintenance Page
- performance is sluggish (e.g. abandoning Review takes for me a minute or so)
fields.summary: Fe/Cru problems after recent upgrade to 2.2
